verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to Al-tashheth. A Psalm of Asaph, a Song. We give thanks <WH3034> unto thee <WH430>, O God; We give thanks <WH3034>, for thy name <WH8034> is near <WH7138>: Men tell <WH5608> of thy wondrous works <WH6381>.
When I shall find <WH3947> the set <WH4150> time <WH8199>, I will judge uprightly <WH4339>.
The earth <WH776> and all the inhabitants <WH3427> thereof are dissolved <WH4127>: I have set up <WH8505> the pillars <WH5982> of it <WH5542>. [[Selah
I said <WH559> unto the arrogant <WH1984>, Deal not arrogantly <WH1984>; And to the wicked <WH7563>, Lift not up <WH7311> the horn <WH7161>:
Lift not up <WH7311> your horn <WH7161> on high <WH4791>; Speak <WH1696> not with a stiff <WH6277> neck <WH6677>.
For neither from the east <WH4161>, nor from the west <WH4628>, Nor yet from the south <WH4057>, cometh lifting up <WH7311>.
But God <WH430> is the judge <WH8199>: He putteth down <WH8213> one <WH7311>, and lifteth up another.

For in the hand <WH3027> of Jehovah <WH3068> there is a cup <WH3563>, and the wine <WH3196> foameth <WH2560>; It is full <WH4392> of mixture <WH4538>, and he poureth out <WH5064> of the same <WH2088>: Surely the dregs <WH8105> thereof <WH7563>, all the wicked of the earth <WH776> shall drain <WH4680> them <WH8354>, and drink them.
But I will declare <WH5046> for ever <WH5769>, I will sing praises <WH2167> to the God <WH430> of Jacob <WH3290>.
All the horns <WH7161> of the wicked <WH7563> also will I cut off <WH1438>; But the horns <WH7161> of the righteous <WH6662> shall be lifted up <WH7311>.
